description:
Takemichi Hanagaki is a freelancer that's reached the absolute pits of despair in his life. He finds out that the only girlfriend he ever had in his life that he dated in middle school, Hinata Tachibana, had been killed by the ruthless Tokyo Manji Gang.

The day after hearing about her death, he's standing on the station platform and ends up being pushed over onto the tracks by a herd of people. He closes his eyes thinking he's about to die, but when he opens his eyes back up, he somehow had gone back in time 12 years.

Now that he's back living the best days of his life, Takemichi decides to get revenge on his life by saving his girlfriend and changing himself that he'd been running away from.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: POV
tags.description: Point of View; features scenes shown from the perspective of the series protagonist.

tags.name: Mopeds
tags.description: Prominently features mopeds.

node.description: **Hatsumi Kouichi** is a Japanese director, character designer, animation director, episode director and storyboard artist.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.
Received a Young Magazine Newcomer Manga Award Honorable Mention for his _Shinjuku Swan_ one-shot in 2004.

[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/eillofficial) | [Twitter](https://mobile.twitter.com/_eill_) | [Soundcloud](https://soundcloud.com/eilljuvenile)

**eill** is a singer-songwriter from Tokyo, Japan.

[Website](https://higedan.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/officialhige) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/officialhigedandism) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/officialhigedandism/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3vg17IZ1IV73xx069jG44w) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5Vo1hnCRmCM6M4thZCInCj)

__Official Hige Dandism__ (Official髭男dism, stylized as Official HIGE DANdism), commonly abbreviated __Higedan__ (ヒゲダン), is a Japanese pop band formed in Shimane, Japan in 2012.

After signing a record deal with the major label Pony Canyon in 2018, Official Hige Dandism released the debut single _"No Doubt"_, the lead single from the extended play, Stand by You EP. The following year, the band released the second single, _"Pretender"_, which ranked at number three on the year-end chart of Billboard Japan Hot 100 in 2019. Their debut studio album Traveler was released on 9 October 2019 and reached number one on the Japan Albums Chart.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members:__
• [Satoshi Fujihara](https://anilist.co/staff/277082) (藤原聡) - born August 19, 1991 (lead vocals, piano)
• Daisuke Ozasa (小笹大輔) - born January 6, 1994 (lead guitar, backing vocals)
• Makoto Narazaki (楢﨑誠) - born March 18, 1989 (bass, saxophone, backing vocals)
• Masaki Matsuura (松浦匡希) - born January 22, 1993 (drums, percussion, backing vocals)

Currently seated at Studio Z.

Applied to Studio No. 1 as a 15-year-old in the hopes of getting to work with [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/), but there were no seats available. She then instead joined [Osamu Kamijou](https://anilist.co/staff/155388/)'s studio.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [younger animator](https://anilist.co/staff/274813/)._

Hiroo Maruyama is a producer working for Mainichi Broadcasting System (MBS).

He joined Mainichi Broadcasting in 1999. Was transferred later to the Tokyo office and took over duties relating to the production of animation broadcasts. He was responsible for production on series like Gundam Seed, Gundam Seed Destiny and Full Metal Alchemist, all part of the 6:00pm Saturday timeblock, which gained wide popularity.
